annotation.TEXT: BGM: Super Scope 6 - Blastris Type A
Now I gotta redo it.
Once you hit the sprite limit, no more fish will appear. But, why create so many fish? What use could they possibly be?
Wheeeee!!!
Can I at least get one koopa to run over this way?
What the...? Now where'd my wings go? Did you guys take them?
Block cloning in one of these rooms can have some interesting effects. You may end up getting loads of 1-ups...
To see where I learned that glitch that eventually led to Yoshi's demise, click here.
Regardless of how you do this glitch, if you enter a pipe or return to the map while riding invisible Yoshi, it'll reappear and become normal again.
Now this is strange, and I have no idea why it was programmed this way, but if you scroll a spike top off the screen vertically, it vanishes, and doesn't respawn (as if it was killed)!
Weird. Sometimes that happens as you eat a parachuting enemy. I think it depends on the way it was swinging at the time.

Umm... Where did Lakitu go?! Sometimes in this level, the sprite limit will cast X-zone on Lakitu (or something like that) when you approach the goal. If this happens, he won't respawn, and his cloud will have no time limit!
If Yoshi eats an item below the bottom of the screen, or at the same exact time you touch it, you may get it twice!
By the way, this glitch also causes me to become hidden behind the foreground (layer 1). But if I hop off Yoshi, he becomes visible again!
Well, being green koopas, this isn't gonna work very well...
Oops... Darn it!
Uhh... Toasty?
BGM: Cave Story - Balrog's Theme
Going up!
That is, under normal circumstances, but this block is touching a screen border to the left, so going left just gives me another Star 2 instead.

Note that while I was able to hit that spiny, this won't work on everything. I think it depends on whether the sprite is moving horizontally or not (to be able to get a tiny bit closer to you, just close enough to cape smack).
Can't fry it either...
D'oh! Just missed a 1-up...
Well, I do have this silver P-switch here...
Aha! I'm riding an invisible Yoshi!
BGM: Mother / Earthbound - New Age Retro Hippie
Also, I've done a different version of P-switch recycling: If a stomped P-switch falls completely off screen before it goes "Poof!", it'll respawn in its original location!
Glitch count: 01
Baby Yoshi feeding glitch: Feed him two enemies in quick succession (but not too quick), and you'll get credit for an additional enemy.
...or something like this could happen!
If you've watched my "No A or B button" videos, you should know what's next!
Boy, that was a long level (over 9 minutes)! I think I'll choose a short level next!
If you create a shell in this way, it'll remain hidden until you hit it with something (like Mario's cape).
Oftentimes, I just use up my reserve item for this, but any power up will do.
Did I just... FRY YOSHI?!?!
Now I'm not done with this level yet, but I'm grabbing these Yoshi Coins now. If I don't, they'll vanish when I change areas since I've already collected five!
Hey! Where'd that spike top go?
Just like the P-switch fish glitch, you can create extra shell-less koopas this way!
Let's do some more block cloning shenanigans!
42-life combo!
More block cloning! This is a Star 2 block (produces a star only if I'm already invincible), so on its right, I should get a 1-up, and on its left, I should get a vine.
BGM: Super Mario Land 2 - Space Zone Map
(Have Yoshi eat a power up as you start entering a pipe.)
I think I'm just about done with this level. Now let's clear it, but in an unusual way, of course!
BGM: DKC2 - Welcome to Crocodile Isle
More P-switch recycling: If you carry a stomped P-switch through a pipe before it vanishes, it'll be good as new on the other side!

Have Yoshi eat a control coin, and the P-switch music will remain indefinitely (or until you leave the area). Note that sometimes, this may not work, depending on the angle Yoshi eats the control coin.
Uh, oh! The exit pipe is plugged up! How do I get out?! Well, luckily, I happen to have a "Plunger"-switch with me! That'll unclog it for sure! (Don't leave home without it!)
Aha! Now I can fry it! And I can keep frying the coin for some reason!
And now I have no time limit! I'm free to hang around as long as I want now!
Also, I can't collect the coin either.
Glitch count: 02
Whoa! It can get ridiculous sometimes!
Hmm... I seem to be unable to dismount this invisible Yoshi.
It's a... really glitched sprite!
Hmm... Can't interact with it...
BGM: Chrono Trigger - Corridors of Time
BGM: See video description. I'm not typing all that up here!
And now for the usual P-switch recycling method. Also, fish!
Alright, enough fooling around. I want to go to the bonus room now!
Well, they contributed to the loss of my wings, because you see, it's the sprite limit at work again! Let me get over to a good spot to show you what Yoshi's got in his mouth now.

Whether you can hop off an invisible Yoshi depends on how you caused this glitch. If you do this glitch by hopping on a Yoshi before all the cloned Yoshis finish hatching, you can dismount the resulting invisible Yoshi in that case.
Hmm... I want those coins, so bye, Yoshi!
Alright, let's start off with one of the best levels for glitches: Chocolate Island 5!
P-switch BGM: Cave Story - Access
Star BGM: Mega Man 4 - Final Wily Battle
Not exactly a glitch, but you can hit enemies by hitting a block that's adjacent to them in any direction!
SMW challenge by poddish: Exploit as many glitches as possible in three levels or fewer.
Quadruple Hi, Yoshi!
Push!
Ow. The munchers still hurt, it seems.
Ah, the classic double grab! Just don't change power ups or get hit, or else you'll probably drop one and have to do it again!
Hmm... I want to try making several fish at once, but the silver P-switch kind of screws with that, so let's use the blue one.
Another odd thing: After using this glitch, the music won't change for P-switches (and probably stars, too) as long as you remain in the same area.
For my final act, I choose Donut Secret 2!
First, we'll start off with some basic block cloning.
It's interesting how far your spinning cape can actually reach...
Death BGM: Super Marisa World - World 1
BGM: Katamari Damacy - Nananan Katamari Sepia
What if I were to perform this glitch?
Glitch count: 00
BGM: The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya - Bouken Desho Desho
Oh, yeah! I almost forgot. I'm going to want a feather at some point, so I should get it now.
The "avoid time up death" glitch: Have Yoshi eat a power up just as the clock hits zero. If timed right, you'll live!
But what if I... Oh, no...
Hmm... That's interesting... Now let's try the block factory!
And the game's not letting me collect my reserve feather either! Not that it matters, since I'll be dead in a few seconds anyway...
Glitch count: ?? Oh, screw this! I'm outta here!
Let's see if I can create some shell-less koopas for me to run over with the star!

If that additional enemy happens to be the fifth one, the enemy Yoshi was trying to eat may glitch up and you can't interact with it! (But you can still turn it into a silver coin with a silver P-switch, which you can then collect normally.)
